Hi Michael,
   You can either modify the preconfig file with user configura=
tion
options such as USE_NUMERIC, or you can create a preprocessor that
def=
ines environmental variables before calling preconfig. Enclosed is an
examp=
le of a preprocessor that I use to compile 32 bit on a 64 bit linux
machine=
. 
It uses USE_NUMERIC for the python math option. The Numeric python
packa=
ge has been previously installed in the default site-package
directory (/us=
r/local/python/2.3.5/lib/python2.3/site-packages) for the
default python ex=
ecutable located in /usr/local/bin/python.

Hope this helps,
Harry


#!/bin=
/sh
#
#
CANTERA_CONFIG_PREFIX=3D/home/hkmoffa/arch/linux/cantera-1.6_develo=
p
export CANTERA_CONFIG_PREFIX

SET_PYTHON_SITE_PACKAGE_TOPDIR=3Dy
export S=
ET_PYTHON_SITE_PACKAGE_TOPDIR

PYTHON_SITE_PACKAGE_TOPDIR=3D$CANTERA_CONFIG=
_PREFIX
export PYTHON_SITE_PACKAGE_TOPDIR

PYTHON_CMD=3D/usr/local/bin/pyth=
on
export PYTHON_CMD

PYTHON_PACKAGE=3D'full'
#PYTHON_PACKAGE=3D'minimal'
e=
xport PYTHON_PACKAGE

WITH_IDEAL_SOLUTIONS=3D"y"
export WITH_IDEAL_SOLUTION=
S

WITH_ELECTROLYTES=3D"y"
export WITH_ELECTROLYTES

BUILD_MATLAB_TOOLBOX=
=3D"n"
export BUILD_MATLAB_TOOLBOX

BUILD_F90_INTERFACE=3D"n"
export BUILD_=
F90_INTERFACE

NUMARRAY_HOME=3D''
export NUMARRAY_HOME

GRAPHVIZDIR=3D'/hom=
e/hkmoffa/arch/linux/bin'
export GRAPHVIZDIR

#
# Only Numeric is installed=
 in the
/usr/local/python/2.3.5/lib/python2.3/site-packages
# directory cur=
rently.
#
USE_NUMERIC=3D"y"
export USE_NUMERIC

BUILD_WITH_F2C=3D"n"
export=
 BUILD_WITH_F2C

BITCOMPILE=3D"32"
export BITCOMPILE

CXX=3D'g++  -m32 -Wa,=
--32'
export CXX

CC=3D'gcc  -m32 -Wa,--32'
export CC

F77=3D'g77 -m32 -Wa,=
--32'
export F77

CFLAGS=3D"-g -Wall"
export CFLAGS

CXXFLAGS=3D"-g -fPIC -=
Wall -DDEBUG_HKM"
export CXXFLAGS

FFLAGS=3D"-g -fPIC -DDEBUG_HKM"
export F=
FLAGS

LDFLAGS=3D'-m32 -Wa,--32'
export LDFLAGS

LCXX_END_LIBS=3D"-lm -lstd=
c++"
export LCXX_END_LIBS

EXTRA_LINK=3D"-m32 -Wa,--32"
export EXTRA_LINK

=
MAKE=3Dgmake
export MAKE

USE_SUNDIALS=3D'n'
export USE_SUNDIALS
SUNDIALS_H=
OME=3D'/home/hkmoffa/libraries/sundials'
export SUNDIALS_HOME

./preconfig
=

>    The default changed from using the Numeric pa=
ckage to using the 
> numarray package for Python's matrix operations. I th=
ink you have to 
> set USE_NUMERIC to 'y' in the preconfig file, and then t=
ry again.
> 
> Best wishes,
> Harry
